questions.question: Will you wait here ....................... I return?
I visit my grandparents ........................... I can.
questions.description: Whenever means it doesn't matter when.

questions.question: You must finish the job ........................ you leave.
I injure my ankle .......................... I play football.
questions.description: We are not talking about any particular occasion here. Hence, whenever is used.

questions.question: I injured my knee .............................. playing football yesterday.
I told her the news ............................ she arrived.
questions.description: As a conjunction, the moment can mean as soon as.

questions.question: I will buy it only .......................... you reduce the price.
questions.description: We use if to express a condition.

questions.question: .......................... I was sleepy, I sat through the lecture.
questions.description: We use though to connect two contrasting ideas. It is similar to but in meaning.

questions.question: I was tired ........................... I didn't go.
questions.description: So is a conjunction. Hence and therefore are transitional adverbs. They cannot connect clauses.

questions.question: ........................ art does not offer good career prospects, few people are interested in pursuing it.
questions.description: Since can express the reason for something.
